content: This looks like it could be an amazing game but please, please, please fix the online dual mode. Was unable to play an online game as the app would randomly kick either me or the other player out of the game at the start. I will reconsider my rating if you can fix this.
Last update 2018... It says all
Challenging and entertaining

Unplayable on Android TV or box. Game launches, then notification screen pops to let one know about online play, Asmodee Digital account, and tutorial with no way to by-pass it. Works fine on Note 9. For the purests, this plays nothing like the box game.
Why does this app need permissions to make phone calls??

I have the game in the box and on my phones. I've been playing it on my phones for two years -- Samsung Galaxy S5 & S8+ -- with no issues in single player or duel mode. Never has crashed or had any glitches/bugs/etc.
Keeps crashing when trying to play online
Half of the time the computer doesn't make a move and I have to restart to make it work.
A great version of the game, but the AI is too smart for me. I lose every time.
Was good while it lasted. Haven't been able to play in a while. Just says license verification failed when I start the game. Just quits out.
great game but it sometimes will freeze going from player to AI having to reset the current game.
tried to play online, other player keeps getting kick

If the developer is reading, I'm thoroughly perplexed as to how to play in Duel mode with a friend on the same device. As far as I can tell, a critical aspect of this game is that the player who is Jack knows the suspect card they are playing as. Yet in Duel mode I can find no way at all for the player who is Jack to find out which suspect they are. The Duel mode game just goes straight in to the first turn. There doesn't seem to be anything I can see to click on for Jack to see who they are.
buggy(sometimes ai stuvk on 2 turn), poor ux(cant undo actions once selected)
AI got stuck in the tutorial.

The game itself is fine. I am a boardgame fan and wanted to try this for a while. The app is ok but the AI cheats big time. When the computer is the detective it makes decisions they only make sense if you know who is Jack. Takes the fun out of it.
replyContent:
Hi Jonathan Clark,
Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry for the issues you're encountering with Mr Jack. In order to help us fix this, can you please contact support at this address: https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/mr-jack-pocket/?fbclid=IwAR1Q_44ZAO-xaqnfbBP1v2a11KUUNX8Gqnu85BzySMZIoQCD2VpB_DBsEn4&p=android
Thank you,
Asmodee Digital team.

content: Good game, but the online feature does not work at all.

I played this boardgame years ago so I remembered rules a bit but still I 
went through this app's tutorial. It was the worst game tutorial I have 
ever seen even if rules are really simple. If you want to purchase the 
game, read the rulebook first. Also I think that "speeding up animations" 
option doesn't spead up the tokens drawing enough. Game takes much longer 
than it should because of all those rotating tokens and flying stuff. This 
is frustrating experience. Game itself is great, app not so much.

This is frustrating. The computer uses move cards but then does not move 
the character. I'm not able to do this!
Good deduction game, but the game dont save progress, lost when exit - on Xiao Mi Mix 2 Andriod 7
Great adaptation. With hard AI it is really challenging to win. It is a good alternative, if you don't have anyone to play with a printed board game on the table.

A fun way to pass the time. You basically have a tile grid in which other characters can "look" down depending on whether the view is open or not. Each tile has a person on it. If your character does not see a person that is Jack, they are flipped over. If they see Jack in their line of site, all people in that line of site are kept face up. The idea is to narrow down the search until you only see Jack. In the mean time, the AI tries to frustrate your search through certain actions. It is a lot of fun and a great way to pass time. The AI is also challenging. As opposed to other reviewers, I have never encountered any problems.

I've never played the board game but it doesn't quite work as a mobile game for me. Little to simple and not quite long enough. Much better board game ports out there (which isn't really the fault of the developers!)
AI gets stuck on its turn affecting UI also. Need to close App. Takes the concept of the original game very well.
Love the game but online seems to be busted. Paid for an app that doesn't work anymore because of poor online services.
replyContent:
Hello Chris, 

We are deeply sorry about this. 
Our team is currently working on this. 
Don't hesitate to contact the support: 
https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/mr-jack-pocket/
Once again we are sorry. 

Best regards, 
Asmodee Digital support

content: Game AI periodically gets stuck and deadlocks itself, requiring exiting the gane. Hope it gets corrected soon because vthis is a nice little timewaster / brain teaser. Avoid the tutorial, just jump into the animated rules.

Update 4th Jan 2018: Game still freezes on AI. Also Chase mode seems buggy (doesn't come on if you're Jack).   Game looks pretty, just needs a patch. Sadly Asmodee have been really bad at fixing known issues.
replyContent:
hello, 

Thanks for your feedback.

best regards,

content: Enkelt att komma igång, en livstid att till fullo bemästra.
It is a great game, and had a good AI. Recently it freezes though, every time it's Mr Jack's turn. Mostly unusable until this fix.
Plays well, no freezing up. Playing against AI, darn near impossible to win. Game mechanic or super AI is the problem. Removing game out of frustration.
Such slow animations. Couldn't undo grabbing the wrong card on the small phone screen
Multiplayer is so unstable that a full game is impossible! Solo is fine and it is fun..

AI is passable for gameplay, but tutorial text is inaccurate to the point of uselessness.

content: Locks up almost every game
Freezes around half of the games.
Works perfectly, plays just like the analogue version. AI performance is not amazing but competent.
Crashes frequently, can't pass tutorial.

...but the artwork is mediocre, the English translation is terrible, and the infuriating slow animations make this nearly unplayable. The artwork and English are forgivable, but until they fix the irritating animation speed, I'd suggest avoiding this one.

Great digital port of the physical game.  Captures the suspense and challenge.  If anything I'd change it would be to make the AI graphics faster, and also to be able to retract a chosen action (grab the move sherlock by mistake and stuck with moving sherlock...).
The game is fun and user interface is good.

Fun strategy and thinking ahead: "if I do this, then he'll do that, then I'll do this". The only way that I have won as Mr. Jack was when using the 3 optional characters: James Maybrick, Walter Sickert, and Lizzie Williams. Their tiles have street/wall configurations that make them easier to hide from the detectives. For example, Walter Sickert's tile has 3 walls, so he can only be seen from one direction, and no others can be seen through his tile. Wish these were sold as an expansion to the board game!
Intelligent, simple to learn game that offers a a great 10 minute experience. Huge replay value.
... of the boardgame. Fans of the latter will do no wrong in picking this up. No issues, responsive developers.  Wish it had online multi player,  hope the sales keep going to afford this feature.

The cards aren't in favor of the AI, I think that people aren't aware to the possible solutions.  Try the tutorial before playing. It took me some time to win at easy mode but once you gain the hang of you understand it is easy. I can't stop playing it,  really addicting. You can play in solo either as Jack or the detective,  but notice that you have to choose the right animation when you choose the game lvl.
Solo play a waste of time and money. Poor rules explanation. Tutorial a joke as it assumes you know the rules prior.

Great game, like the solo, good brain exercise, yes the AI is tough, but I like. One problem, if doubling a detective on one space, can't select the space if on the side of the grid as it goes off the screen (width). So lost a few times when I couldn't select the space to double up.

Horrible game if solo, only worthy against another person, AI always deals itself beneficial hands that almost always gives it a setup to win...random card generation doesn't exist, Which defeats the point of playing this game. Update: after continued playing have determined to delete game and materials, wish I bought a different game.
Fun game to play, but the AI is absurdly hard even on easy. Perhaps a lower level than easy is needed for new players?

Needs a surrender-button (when you know you've lost, but you still need to play your actions and wait for the sloooooow animations. The 'speed up animations' in the settings doesn't work. Apart from that it's a great game.
The AI is brutal, though. Multilingual support excellent for my kids.
Love this game, I have the board game as well. I would like to eventually see a online game play for this.

Good brain burning deduction game. The AI is a bit tough, as in it gets the better actions a lot of the times and it ends up screwing up your set ups quite quickly. The new characters make things even tougher by adding more barriers into the mix. The games i have won were simply when the game favored me with the right action at the right time. Also, it would be nice to have an indicator for when who is about to get 2 turns in a row and having the option to change actions before it is executed.  👍

I enjoy the board game "Mr. Jack", so I wanted to give this apparently "light" version a try. It's not actually a light version of Mr. Jack, though, but a completely new game that just works well in a tablet or phone. I can't imagine the real game being any more fun than this. It's a brain burner, but one you can play in 5 minutes. Lots of fun.
Thank you for bringing this game to Android.
Simple yet depth
Great fun game which makes you think ahead.  But be warned you will lose the A.I. is tough.  Another great board game.
I beat the game on easy the 1st time. People complaining that it is too hard is a joke.

The game has great production value and it is extremely fun, however like others have mentioned,  it is extremely difficult. Easy should be toned down a bit. Either that or the difficulties should be HARD, HARDER, HARDEST. The A.I seems to "randomly" get what it needs every single time. Will definitely 5 star when it becomes beatable.                                  P.S: No need for a defensive reply Meeple Touch. The game is harder than it should be and that's a fact.

Excellent game and a very quality remake of the popular board game. Definitely a must-have for board gamers looking for a deduction game with Days of Wonder-like production values. I am looking forward to picking up the board game as well after enjoying this game so much!
The awesome tabletop game is now on mobile. It plays great, great graphics. Great job!
I am addicted.  I can't get enough of this game.  Replayability is great.  Looking to buy the actual game for the family to play.  Love it!!
Difficult to understand in the beginning, but very interesting when you really start playing.
Excellent and very intuitive implementation of the game. Recommended!
this is a simple and yet challeging game once you get your head round the rules. Well worth a go.
Having a feeling that tile draws aren't random. Nothing like being in chase mode and then being handed no possible way to win.
replyContent: Tiles are drawn randomly and the AI is not cheating. The game is quite challenging but if you first practice in easy mode you will soon see how to improve your play (try to lower degree of liberty of AI by choosing actions giving you the higher options like exchange and rotation  and letting it with character move which is more predictable)

content: Great game. Immense re-playability and just fun to play. Only problem is trying to view the rules on the phone. Very difficult to even locate--almost off screen icon on my phone--Samsung GS3. That's only flaw, otherwise excellent.
Wish it had pass-and-play, though. That would have been very easy to implement.
Masterize it!
THE AI IS BRUTAL. If there's a difference between easy and hard I can't tell it.
replyContent: There's a lot of difference between Easy and Hard AI, best players beat the AI 90% of time in Easy mode but far less in Hard mode.

content: Really needs to support 2 player vs option. We just need to get around Mr. Jack's "hidden" hourglasses to implement it.  All in all a good app to make a portable version of a Great game even more portable.

The developers did an excellent job turning this fun board game into an app. My only complaint is no multi-player. There is a single player ladder which is nice, but not the same thing as a multi-player ladder. Nevertheless this game is worth your money. You'll get loads of enjoyment from it as it's very challenging/interesting. As a single player game it's 5+ stars for how well the app is built and for how intelligent the computer AI is.

Really good adaptation of the board game. And the AI can get really hard so it's nice and challenging. I think this game lends itself to the app format well and the app developers did a really nice job too. So I sedimentary recommend this for anyone who lived the board game and everyone who likes detective brain teasers.
Great sort game that has lots of replay value!

I have never played the physical version, but am really liking this digital version. Works properly at all aspects and is fun and challenge. Great to have a game where it feels like you truly need to outwit not only the board but yourself. Only nit pick is to have more interactive tutorial, like a demo run after the rules tutorial.

This is an absolutely fabulous board game for Android.  The presentation is incredibly polished, the A.I. puts up a great fight (even on "easy") and the gameplay is just the right length for portable devices.  This is how mobile board games should be done   More please!

Really enjoyed this one as a great deduction game. Seems equally balanced between the computer AI and the player. Only downside seems to be no pass and play option, oh and the application eats batteries,

My only gripes is that the tutorial missions can be unclear (though there is a lightbulb moment when you do figure it out) and that exiting the game sometimes just restarts it. Otherwise, this is a solid forward-thinking game.
Vraiment addictif et l'IA est très fort, même au niveau facile.

I love the physical copy of the game and glad we now have an electronic version for when I am by myself but still want to play the game. We need more of such boardgames on Android.  Would be better if the statistics and rankings used the Google Play Games service. :)
replyContent: Unfortunately the Google Play Game service does not suit this specific game needs (2 leaderboards and be able to store score and level achieved). I agree using the google play service will be better once theee needs can be fulfilled.

content: Great conversion of the board game with good AI.

I like the boxed game and was looking forward to trying this digital version. But...it downloaded in French. Is there a way to get the English version? Or can the language be selected within the game? Turns out there is. Thanks for the assist
replyContent: You can simply switch languages by using the small flags at the bottom of the screen Menu. English is the second one from the left.

content: Can you out smart the investigators in Blitz mode?

I love all of the games in this series, and the Android version of Mr. Jack pocket is a spot on implementation of the board game.  The AI also seems reasonably decent so far, and I like the fact that it keeps track of various stats about wins/losses.  I wish other android board games had this level of polish.
